newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli shekel gains on dollar, basket.
newsitem.headline: Israeli shekel gains on dollar, basket.

text.p: The Israeli shekel's representative rate was fixed slightly higher against the dollar and the basket of key foreign currencies on Wednesday in mixed and quiet trading, dealers said.
"Trading was very quiet today with slightly more conversions of foreign currency into shekels," said a dealer at Israel Discount Bank.
"Volume was relatively low and the shekel remined stable during the entire session," she said.

The representative rate for the dollar was fixed at 3.3990 shekels against 3.4010 on Tuesday. The basket, composed of the dollar, mark, pound sterling, French franc and yen, was fixed at 3.6942 shekels against 3.6961 on Tuesday.
On the crosses, the shekel traded against the yen at 2.8639 shekels per 100 yen compared with 2.8543 on Tuesday, and against the mark at 1.9913 shekels compared with 1.9994 on Tuesday.
In the late afternoon, the dollar was trading at 3.3980 shekels.
